intro: Manulea villosa, commonly known as the hairy manulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow to orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
